Plan ahead: Start preparing the holiday dinner months in advance. Make a list of all the ingredients you will need and plan out the menu. This will help you avoid last-minute stress and ensure that everything is ready on time.

Use a slow cooker: A slow cooker is a great way to cook a large holiday dinner. You can put everything in the slow cooker and let it cook slowly throughout the day. This will free up your time to do other things and ensure that the food is cooked evenly.
Cook in batches: If you're cooking everything from scratch, consider cooking in batches. This will help you avoid feeling overwhelmed and ensure that everything is cooked to perfection.
Use a meal delivery service: Consider using a meal delivery service to help you prepare your holiday dinner. Many services offer pre-made holiday meals that you can simply heat up and serve.

Get help from family and friends: Don't be afraid to ask for help from family and friends. You can divide the work among everyone and make the holiday dinner a group effort. This will not only make the preparation process more enjoyable but also give you the opportunity to spend quality time with your loved ones.
